review_body:
By far, my most disappointing purchase on Amazon ever.
I purchased this for my child, and tried to set up the "teen" profile. The teen profile is slightly, if at all, different from the toddler profile. So, if I want my child to actually USE the device, I have to set him/her up as an adult, thereby obtaining access to ALL of my content.
Amazon should be ashamed of themselves for touting what could be a terrific product as "kid friendly" when Freetime and Parental Controls are so obviously broken.
Parents of children over 9 - LOOK ELSEWHERE!!!
review_tidy: disappointing purchase Amazon ever purchased child tried teen profile teen profile slightly different toddler profile want child actually device adult thereby obtaining access content Amazon ashamed touting could terrific product friendly Freetime Parental Controls obviously broken Parents children LOOK ELSEWHERE

review_body: While I purchased this tablet for a very attractive price and I think it does some functions very well I am disappointed by some aspects of the tablet. First it does have advertising when you turn it on, that itself is not a big deal, but the fact that several Android apps don't work on the device is a true impact on me. In particular the lack of support for google chrome is a real deal breaker for me. If you are looking for a device to consumer amazon content this tablet will do a nice job at a very attractive cost. If you want a generalized android tablet you will disappointed and I think there are better alternative for less than $50 more.

review_body:
Pros: 1) nice looking screen 2) long battery life.

Cons: 1) riddled with ads - it seems that showing you ads is way more important than letting you get to your apps and actually enjoying the tablet. 2) Buggy - at least once a day it locks up and I have to restart it probably because of the built in ads and the processing power they consume. 3) No Google Play store - I get it that amazon wants you to buy from them and only them, but not allowing access to Google play just takes away so many useful apps that the Kindle could be used for.

Final opinion: I will be returning this and getting an ad-free, Google play enabled device.

review_body: The Fire HD is a fine little tablet but please do your research, as I wish I had. I was replacing a second generation Kindle to take to Europe. I assumed that the Fire had all the same qualities as the Kindle, with some added enhancements. Not so. The screen does not allow reading in the sun, as does a Kindle, and the device does not download books using Whispernet, as does a Kindle, which was a distinct advantage in rural France where internet is spotty.  Since I already carry an iPad when I travel, the Fire is more of a redundancy than enhancement. I hope my lack of due diligence informs others.
review_tidy: Fire fine little tablet please research wish replacing second generation Kindle take Europe assumed Fire qualities Kindle added enhancements screen allow reading Kindle device download books using Whispernet Kindle distinct advantage rural France internet spotty Since already carry iPad travel Fire redundancy enhancement hope lack diligence informs others

review_body: My main complaint is that 8GB is not enough memory to store anything on this Kindle, and you can't add any more memory. Sure it's all on the cloud- your books, your tunes, etc... It's a full two feet shorter than previous models!!

review_body: The Fire HD may be a fine product if you want a reader with no proper audio jack.  However, make sure you know that Amazon will load this with your account information, including credit card details and a full order history, with no password required.  You'll also get a couple of ads to clear off the screen each time it wakes up.  I'm returning this and buying something else from a company that doesn't presume that I want private information pre-loaded on an easily stolen device, and I'm willing to pay a few bucks more to not have ads.

I have had several Kindles that I was happy with. The last one was a Fire HD. I ended up returning the newest one. Interestingly, I don't have to deal with the ads on the Samsung and have more functionality for the same price.

Also, I'm able to adjust the screen lighting so I can read even in bright sunlight. When I was experiencing problems with the Fire HD in the past I was told to buy a Kindle Paperwhite in addition to the Kindle Fire HD I had at the time.

review_body: This was my second (and last) Kindle. The newer Kindle began having connection issues after a month...  a factory reset seemed to resolve that problem....  and charging issues after two.  Now, the unit is less than  four months old  and will not charge at all.  You, of course, may have better luck with yours, but I'm saving my pennies and buying a Nook.

review_body:
I bought this Kindle because it was a deal at $79 and my other Kindle Fire was a couple years old.
The Pros: Faster processing speed, thinner, sharper display
Cons: with the old one and the new one side by side, the new will not pick up wifi where the old one has 2 to 3 bars and runs fine
the new seems cheaply made where the old one seems a lot sturdier
the new has no plug in for connecting to HDMI on TV where the old one I can plug into HDMI and watch my Amazon Prime videos
Overall I'm a little disappointed in the new Kindle Fire, I find myself using the old one over the new one. The new one seems to be my backup while I'm charging my old one.

review_body:
Google is actively trying to strangle non-Google licensed Android devices from the market like this one. So before you buy this, consider:

1) No Google Play Store, where all of the best apps live
2) No Google Docs (Drive, Sheets, Docs, etc).
3) No Google Maps either
4) No Google Chrome
5) No Gmail app

You can read books, watch videos, etc. Think of it as a window into your Amazon content. Do NOT think of it as a general purpose Android tablet.
review_tidy: Google actively trying strangle Google licensed Android devices market like consider Google Play Store best apps live Google Docs Drive Sheets Docs Google Maps either Google Chrome Gmail read books watch videos Think window Amazon content think general purpose Android tablet

The power button doesn't put the machine to sleep or turn it off. The volume buttons also sometimes jam (without appearing to be jammed) and will move the volume slider all the way down. On the plus side the device is pretty sturdy.

I've read the HDX model is much better so maybe look at that one but if you've ever owned any other tablet, you're not going to like this one.  It's too basic.  I can see this one being good for travel or children but that's about it.

review_body: Great while it lasted.  I got mine as a gift 15 months ago.  Now I have battery and charging issues.  The device is now extremely slow to charge (about 10-15% for 2 hrs charging). My only option is to purchase a new one.  The factory warranty ran out only 3 months ago.  My suggestion is to get an extended warranty when purchasing.  You will need it with the abundance of battery/charging issues with this device all over the internet.

review_body:
Amazon Kindle Fire, the first generation, set the bar high. All subsequent iterations are inferior, in my opinion.
Why? The first generation was built like a Mack Truck , very sturdy, with heft. Almost bullet proof. The newer versions have more bells and whistles, but they are cheap - and you can feel the difference. That's too bad.
For a few bucks, and if you don't mind the built in advertisements (first gen didn't have those either ) it'll do the job, but I'd counsel to spend a few more bucks and get something of better quality.

review_body: Has anyone been watching the latest TV commercials for the Kindle Fire HD, which proclaim how resilient it is to physical damage, and shows a device falling from the top of an SUV onto a driveway and supposedly survives? They should remove this TV ad immediately.

review_body:
The Fire offers beautiful color and some excellent new search features. Unfortunately, it is overly demanding of attention, converting an easy-reading environment into a 3-ring circus screaming, "Buy me, buy me" well beyond the point of distraction.
When might the innovators of technology learn to back off and give the human customer a chance to decide rather than being constantly pushed.
Thanks for now allowing a rating and my words rather than insisting on a specific survey.
review_tidy: Fire offers beautiful color excellent search features Unfortunately overly demanding attention converting easy reading environment ring circus screaming well beyond point distraction When might innovators technology learn back give human customer chance decide rather constantly pushed Thanks allowing rating words rather insisting specific survey

review_body: Worst tablet out there. Ads everywhere. Your background, your lock screen, the margins around your Netflix screen. You can't change it. Wanna play music? Here, buy our songs on Amazon! I almost just factory reset it to regift it, but I don't hate anyone that much. I'd say it was a waste of money, but I won this for free as a prize, so I'll just say it was a waste of my time. I would rather have won the toaster.

review_body:
I did something I never do; I bought something without extensively researching it. Result: I returned it.

I bought the Kindle Fire HD 7 to be able to watch TV and movies on the go. Unfortunately, since it's not true Android - neither are the (limited) apps - it wouldn't work for me. When I attempted to sideload other apps, the device would tell me it was installed, but the app was nowhere to be found. I even found simply using the browser was clunky. Since I already have a Paperwhite - and I love it - I didn't have much use for this otherwise. I ended up buying a Galaxy Tab Pro, like I should have done in the first place.

review_body:
I got this a gift from my 75 year old mother. She got it on "sale" at $15 off. What she didn't know was that the "sale" was because they added some adware to the device. I then had to pay the $15 to get the adware removed. When I turned on the device 10 minutes later to read a book, there is an ad.
It also will not let me use any android apps, only the ones you sell.
So, tell me, how am I supposed to tell my mom that the over $100 she spent on this thing is worth less than nothing and actually cost me money?

PS Yes I do have the courage to use my real name, do you?

review_body:
I had to give this an "OK" just because I'm sure someone would like this tablet (I returned it). However, having had the 3 g Kindle first I didn't care for this tablet for two reasons. Number one: I only had Wifi and no 3g which means I can only buy and download a movie or book when I am at home or where there is free Wifi. With my Kindle, I was in Europe and could download wherever I wanted. I did not want to spend the extra money for the 4g and then have to have a designated line (pay for it).
Number two: It kept knocking me off my e-mail on my laptop which was aggravating having to keep signing in on my laptop e-mail.
Also, too confusing since I have been using Apple products which are so user friendly.

review_body: I've purchased 6 Kindles now (2 as gifts), so I can claim to have some experience with Kindle products. Let's see how long this one lasts, but I doubt I'll buy Kindle #7 if this one dies soon.

review_body:
This is a great little table for reading books or watching netflix. It is also powerful enough to play most of the current popular apps.
The main downside is the firmware and app store. The firmware prevents you from using other app stores and keeps reminding you that this is an amazon branded tablet. Most of the popular apps in the Google play store are available, but others like the youtube app are missing.

I'm enjoying having it as it's a fairly priced pretty good tablet I can use for simple entertainment. For games or work I have another computer.

I got it on Wednesday morning. Kept the battery charged and treated it gently. On Saturday morning, it was dead, dead, dead. I tried different cables, different chargers, plugged it into the computer. Nothing.

On a happier note, I got ahold of Amazon and they are sending a new one right out - I should get it on Wednesday. I have 30 days to send this one back or they'll charge my credit card. No problem whatsoever. They sent me a shipping label and I have it all ready to go back.

I don't know what is to blame for that, but it does cut down on my enjoyment (and I'm kicking myself for giving the old one away).  Also, advertising--especially in the games--is much more aggressive and hard to skip, compared to the older version.  I almost wish I would have opted for one without advertising, although it is more expensive.

review_body:
My Kindle has Malfunctioned after 1 year and 9 months. I think this is disgusting for a product from a business such as Amazon. As you only get 1 year warranty, all Amazon will do is offer you a 10-20 Dollar discount on another Kindle. I am so frustrated and I have looked online and see that this happens quite frequently. So if you are prepared to pay the price using the Kindle for 1 year then go for it, if not I strongly recommend buying another Tablet which does not Malfunction so frequently.

I hope this prevents someone else making the same mistake! I am extremely disappointed in this product and Business.

review_body:
First of all, I originally Kindle 7HD with a blue case 10 days before Christmas as a present for my 11 year old daughter. I was then informed it would be arriving on the 27th. Then I was informed it would be here no later than Jan 28th. But, I could order a plain - black cased Kindle 7HD in exchange. I was informed that it would arrive later that week on a Fri. It actually arrived the following Monday. Not that I am a bad sport, but several other items that I ordered on the 15th of Dec arrived before or on the day specified.

That being said, I am more than pleased with the Kindle 7HD and more importantly so is my daughter. Had it arrived in time for Christmas I would have rated it 5-stars.

Been using the Kindle app on a generic Android tablet for the last 3 years. Finally decided to get a Kindle. Nice picture and good battery life (11 hr plane ride, read for about 6 and still had 60% battery). My main complaint is one that's been around for a long time, Kindle doesn't do folders. Haven't had time to play with its other features, maybe they will increase my rating

review_body:
Why can't I change the background? It can't be done. Search the web... it just can't be done.

Also, there are so many apps missing from the Amazon App store. Why no Snapchat? Why no Instagram? After all, Fire is just the Android operating system re-branded (since Android is open source, Amazon, and anyone else, is allowed to use and rename it). Android apps would work on the Fire if they could be downloaded.

I feel like the people that designed the Fire don't use the Fire. If they did, these simple, yet incredibly annoying, fixes would be implemented.

review_body: I was excited to get the Fire HD as a Christmas gift, but disappointed in the performance.  Some apps, i.e. video slots, get lines and bars through the middle of them, and while it's still playable, it's very annoying.  The unit has a really bad tendency to freeze up, and I end up restarting all the time.  I actually sent back the original, and received a replacement.  But, sadly it has the same issues.  Hopefully they come up with some fixes for this!  I was also disappointed to find that some apps on my original Kindle Fire, are not yet available for HD.  All in all, I would advise you to save your money until the bugs get worked out.

review_body:
I am really enjoying my new kindle fire HD 7, it's pretty much what I wanted in a tablet. There are a few things I don't like which is why I gave it the rating I did. First, the battery dies so quickly, goes from 100% to 89% in about 3 minutes of use. The battery is depleted in under an hour. Second, the screen flickers giving me a headache.
Third, I can't get some of my apps on it that I use for work making it necessary to continue using another device. Technically, that's not really anyone's fault but it is disappointing.

review_body: Had my Kindle Fire HD 7 for a few weeks now.  So far, it's been nice, but here are a few problems I've found.  I've had my iPhone 5 for over a year now, and haven't managed to scratch it yet - scratched the Kindle glass in just a few days.  Battery life is pretty poor compared to my iPhone and iPad.  Finding official apps (like for YouTube or Gmail) is difficult.  If you can get past these things, it's nice.  Lots of books (which is -supposed- to be the primary purpose of a Kindle anyway, right?)  Oh, did I mention that having to pay $15 to not have to look at the annoying ads on the home screen is, well, annoying as h#)(?

review_body:
The good news is that the Kindle Fire HD is a relatively cheap tablet and reader. It has clear graphics.

The bad news is that it locks you into Amazon. You cannot use Google Play. The available apps are limited and often do not work as well as Android apps available on Google Play. The Kindle Fire HD will also not work with free books sites. Amazon uses this platform as a slave to its content.

Bottom line for me is that when the Kindle dies, I will replace it with a tablet from another company.
review_tidy: good news Kindle Fire relatively cheap tablet reader clear graphics news locks Amazon cannot Google Play available apps limited often work well Android apps available Google Play Kindle Fire also work free books sites Amazon uses platform slave content Bottom line Kindle dies replace tablet another company

review_body:
I had a Kindle Fire (used mostly for reading) and I loved it. So, when my kids received one for Christmas, I was very excited for them. That is, until, the first two apps they searched for were not available. American Girl and Disney Movies Anywhere are not available for Kindle? Are you kidding me? I had read negative reviews about the Amazon app store before, but didn't realize that it was this bad. You don't have the Disney Movies app? Really?
If you are primarily a reader, this is a great tablet. If you've looking for more, you may want to look elsewhere. I don't know why Amazon would put out such a nice device and then limit it with a sub par app store. But they have.
review_tidy: Kindle Fire used mostly reading loved kids received Christmas excited That first apps searched available American Girl Disney Movies Anywhere available Kindle kidding read negative reviews Amazon store realize Disney Movies Really primarily reader great tablet looking want look elsewhere know Amazon would nice device limit store

review_body:
I travel alot, and thought it will be a great idea to have a fire HD as a good QPR tablet. Big mistake. The amazon prime 'forgot' the idea of travel, so once you are off US continental, access to all content you have under the subscription is denied. 'violiation of the terms of use'. Why? once cannot take a week vacation?
Well, maybe at least in Canada? well... forget about it.

Conclusion- I am going to ask for my money back or give it to someone who travels as far as CT, just to be on the safe side.

On a scale of five stars, it gets FAIL in service and disclosure of terms and conditions. Too bad

review_body:
If anyone (like for example my 4-year old girl) enters an incorrect PIN 5 times in a row, the Kindle will automatically reset to factor defaults! This is unacceptable in my opinion! It is true, once you re-register it, all of your content comes back. But, you lose bookmarks, progress in games, and anything else that is custom.

And this makes it a great target for thieves! All they have to do it enter a bogus PIN, reset it, voila! Brand new Kindle with no record of who the real owner is.
review_tidy: anyone like example year girl enters incorrect times Kindle automatically reset factor defaults This unacceptable opinion true register content comes back lose bookmarks progress games anything else custom makes great target thieves enter bogus reset voila Brand Kindle record real owner

I called Amazon.com (one will not find the number to easily) and told them that they are showing the same one in stock for $129.  Customer rep had me cancel my order and reorder the $129 one which she said she would credit to $114 but while I ordered the $129 the final check-out came out to be $114 w/o rep doing anything and still got an estimated date of Dec 26.  Why couldn't Amazon.com just shipped me one of the $129 one that was in stock.  THERE"RE THE SAME ITEM

review_body: Loved my kindle fire hd until things stopped working.  First my volume would re-adjust itself at random times.  Then the volume buttons stopped working.  Next was the "safe mode" warnings that hi-jacked my kindle.  I couldn't use any apps just the silk browser. Then I wasn't able to turn it off, or put it in sleep mode.  This drained the battery faster than I could charge it.  I contacted Amazon and they asked me to do a reset.  All that served to do was wipe out my content and saved passwords.  Would love to love it but the durability is just so-so.

Also, when playing WordFeud the Kindle is upside down, I turn it right side up and then the next page is upside down. I literally have to play the game upside down or turn it over after every move. I wish I could return it.

review_body: I would have given it 4 stars, but my 16gb Fire HD 7 has been slow at times and apps have crashed. I've had it for about 2 weeks now, and I've only downloaded 4-5 apps and one book so there is plenty of space. Restarting the Kindle did help. I haven't used it a whole lot yet, so my review may improve if I find that reading books, movie viewing, etc. on it impresses me and/or the lags and app crashing stops. I am very excited to own this tablet, so hopefully the lag and app crashing doesn't become an issue or so cumbersome that I regret this purchase.

review_body: I have bad news for you:  this is a piece of garbage.  I bought one, handled it carefully, and it broke in only two years.  I called Amazon to resolve the issue, and all they would do was offer me a $30 discount on another Kindle.  I spent $622 on Kindle e-books in 2014, but guess how much Amazon valued me as a loyal customer?  Only $30 worth.  Save your money and buy an Apple device and use their e-reader (and buy your e-books through Apple)- that's what I am going to do.  No more Kindle or Amazon e-books for me, since I've learned that the Kindles are not built to last, and Amazon doesn't value my business.

review_body:
Bought this for our 7 year old son. We thought it would be good to encourage his reading and he could play games on it. Have had to replace it two times in less then a year and a half. Both times it just sopped turning on. Now it is not working again, but out of warranty. At this point I would have to pay to replace it. I believe this device is not designed for kids. Have had a first generation iPad for years that the kids have played on, never a single problem with it. If I had it to do again I would have put the money I spent toward an iPad mini. Now I have a device that no one can use.
Would not recommend for children.

review_body: Read the fine print! I just bought 2 Kindle Fire HD 7's for my boys. I went to download a movie to the Kindle for when they travel, and there wasn't enough store (I had literally just pulled it out of the box). I went to my setting to check the available storage and realized I only had 3.85 GB available. I went to amazon.com and pulled up the technical specifications and right there in fine print it says "8 GB (4.5 GB available to user) or 16 GB (11.6 GB available to user) of internal storage." I wish I had realized that before I purchased. The kids will be happy no matter what, but I wish I went with the Samsung.

review_body: While there are some great things about the Kindle Fire HD7, buyers should beware that they will not have the advertised storage space available.  While the Kindle Fire HD is advertised to come with 8 or 16 GB of storage, you won't have this amount of storage available.  More than 40% is not accessible - for the 8GB, only 4.5GB is actually available to use and for the 16GB, only 11.6GB is actually available to use.  This means that you can't even download one single HD movie on an "8 GB" Kindle Fire HD7, and this is with minimal other apps on the device.  That is pretty pathetic.  Overall, we were pretty disappointed.

I was deeply disappointed with the performance relative to my older Kindles. Game play is much, much slower than on the older Kindle Fires that I have. And the form factor is a bit odd. I was hoping that the screen would be larger and I didn't expect the newer Kindle to be so much thicker than the old ones. One nice thing is that the power cord connects to the side instead of coming out of the top or bottom. Not having the kindle sit on top of the power plug is an improvement.

For a very cheap, low-end product, it fills the bill, but don't expect it to be better than the higher-end models.

Thank you,
D. Fraser

review_body:
To me, due to the removal of the HDMI port, this is a severe downgrade from the older model. The HDMI port allowed me to connect my Kindle to any TV with HDMI, or a projector screen, which I used frequently. The new models only seem to connect to specifically equipped TV's...so to connect to a TV, I'll have to go out and buy a whole new TV!

I was looking forward to the new models for the larger storage capacity...but without the HDMI, they are less useful than any other Android tablet out there, which have access to 3/4 million more apps than the Kindles do.

Bad move, Amazon....

I've owned one of the first B&W readers, and then a 1st generation Fire. I consider both ground breaking. Really jaw dropping. This Fire is more of a "so-so" improvement. It's not as intuitive to learn as the 1st generation fire, and the screen really isn't all that much better (which, by the way, isn't bad).
I suppose what gave it away to me was that when I got a survey from Amazon shortly after I received my new Fire, the questions had to do with my color preference. No questions about ease of use, "gee wiz" technology, etc., just the color I chose.
So, I'm an Amazon Fire fan - I was just hoping to see another quantum leap. It was more of a timid step.
review_tidy: owned first readers generation Fire consider ground breaking Really dropping This Fire improvement intuitive learn generation fire screen really much better suppose gave away survey Amazon shortly received Fire questions color preference questions ease technology color chose Amazon Fire hoping another quantum leap timid step

review_body:
This is a good tablet with good price, but not good for multi-tasking. for example if I use one tab in the browser for listening to something, when I open a new tab, the sound is gone! Or when I start to browse Internet while talking to someone in skype, after a minute or two the call will be terminated!!
That's very strange to me.
I also believe that battery gets low quickly. When I play a game while keeping the Kindle connected to power outlet, it still runs out of battery! also very weird! (I have tried to minimize the power usage by changing the brightness setting, but had no effect.)

review_body:
I had an original Kindle Fire, and loved it. I decided to upgrade because of the storage (double the original) and because of the camera features. Well.... fail on the camera - it is horribly grainy. Dig out your old flip phone... seriously. More space is good of course, but it comes at a price: the thing runs super-hot within 10 minutes of turning it on, the battery power is not nearly as robust as the first, and it's also thicker, so if you have covers & cases for the original 7" fire - throw them out.
I have upgrade regret bigtime.

The sound on my older kindle may not be as good as I would like, but the picture quality is excellent, and when I use earbuds the sound is very good.
I will be returning this kindle as soon as I can get my printer running.

I have had a kindle for 2 years now and it is still working great. I recommend this to people who don't like apple and/or android. Ever since I got a kindle 2 years ago, all my family members wanted one. My grandma, Grandmother, aunt, two sisters and one friend each got a kindle fire.
One issue though, (it is a big issue for me) my kindle fire hd 7 2nd gen, uses more battery when it is off than when it is on. one night, it had 34 percent battery, and it was dead in the morning. other than that, it is a great tablet to have!
review_tidy: kindle years still working great recommend people like apple android Ever since kindle years family members wanted grandma Grandmother aunt sisters friend kindle fire issue though issue kindle fire uses battery night percent battery dead morning great tablet

review_body: This device has been amazing!  It is quick, and keeps up with the streaming I do sometimes.  It is also great for reading books, which I enjoy. I have some headphones for it, and while I'm on the bus I can listen to music which is on the device.  Amazon Prime has provided me with many choices of books, videos and music.  Over the last couple of months, I watched the entire series, "The Sopranos", for free!  I got the 8 GB version for my son, and he loves it.  The only thing I would do differently would be to get the 16 GB one for him.

review_body: I had an older model of the Kindle Fire which I liked very much. I got the Fire HD 7 to upgrade to a model with a camera and HD quality, and just an updated version. I use it in place of my laptop and for most of the things it is able to do. I like it very much, once I got used to some of the slight differences. Having a camera and video camera is a nice addition. Reading and listening to books work just as well as with the Kindle Fire. Picture quality is very nice. I am a little disappointed in the sound quality. I thought it would be better since it has two speakers. Overall, I think it is a great product.

review_body: Yay

I was previously using the Samsung Galaxy Tab 3. I find the Kindle to hold a better battery life and be easier to hold. It does seem a bit harder to navigate for me but my son mastered it within a couple days. I love the parental controls, I can choose what to add to his profile and take it away, I do not let him have access to any type of actual internet just my approved apps. The screen is sharp and clear, great for streaming shows, or when he does his alphabet tracing apps. We have incorporated this into our home schooling curriculum and I couldn't be any more happy with this addition.

review_body:
My feelings are a bit mixed on the HD 7. I bought this as an upgrade from my Gen 2, which after nearly three years of use was starting to feel it's age a bit. Right away I was thrilled with the bright and beautiful picture quality. It was when I started trying to use my apps that I became a bit disappointed. Facebook was, and still is, very slow to load and sometimes crashes. I keep getting logged out of Words with Friends and have to constantly reconnect. It just seems like it runs much, much slower and a bit clunkier than my Gen 2 did.

It's still a great tablet, for a really great price, but I have taken to using this as my back up and use my Gen2 as my main.
review_tidy: feelings mixed bought upgrade nearly three years starting feel Right away thrilled bright beautiful picture quality started trying apps became disappointed Facebook still slow load sometimes crashes keep getting logged Words Friends constantly reconnect seems like runs much much slower clunkier still great tablet really great price taken using back main

review_body:
We got this for my 9 yr old daughter for Xmas because she wanted an iPad. Why didn't we get the iPad??? Because it's too expensive. However, this kindle Fire has definitely meet ours and her expectations. It is a little getting used to navigating through the interface.
The only negative thing I can say about it is there are a lot of ads and can get a little frustrating. Other than that, it's fast,great resolution, and the apps load fast. Well worth the $130 bucks I paid (16g).

review_body: Mostly meets our expectations. There were some mixed reviews on Amazon so was a bit worried that we might make a wrong choice here. But, with free subscriptions to magazines and ability to read your PDF and .mobi files saved the day! Wifi sometimes drops when switching between different access points (at home and outside) and needs device re-start, it's mostly stable when you are latched on to one access point. The battery surprisingly needs to be re-charged more frequently than I would have expected (clearly not 8 hrs of screen time as advertised). On the whole, happy with it so far.

review_body: The 1st one had to be replaced - defective - it wouldn't power up after a week of use. I've had the 2nd one for a couple of months now. Battery life is better than expected, there are tons of apps available, the speakers are better than expected. My primary reason for getting it was to read Kindle books - I haven't been disappointment. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars, is that it costs me $140+ (I got the one with expanded memory, no ads, & bought the extended warranty). Also I did invest in a cover for it - was worried about dropping it and cracking the screen. I'd certainly recommend it to anyone who reads a lot of e-books.

review_body:
(Writing from my kindle fire HD 7)

Three kindle fire hd 7 is a wonderful tablet. Here are the pros and cons:

Pros:
- Great display
- Fast
- Has a nice, clean OS
- Nice cameras
- LOVE the keyboard. Has a Swype thing.
- Has a lot of good apps supported
- Starts up fast
- Decent battery life
- Very responsive

Cons:
- Lots of apps have glitches, or are not supported well.
- There are graphic problems on the carousel
- The carousel gets kind of annoying
- There are some bugs

The are some problems, but overall it is great.
review_tidy: Writing kindle fire Three kindle fire wonderful tablet Here pros cons Pros Great display Fast nice clean Nice cameras LOVE keyboard Swype thing good apps supported Starts fast Decent battery life Very responsive Cons Lots apps glitches supported well There graphic problems carousel carousel gets kind annoying There bugs problems overall great

It is OK. Major bummer is the llimitation on the apps. You cannot access the Google Play Store and that is a disabling limitation on the usefullness of this tablet. I won it so I really can't complain all that much. It does work and that's about the best thing to say.

Other than that, 8Gigs is not enough to do anything productive except read books, and since Kindle does not have an SD card slot, the handicap is greater than that of competitor.

If I buy a tablet, it will be the HP Stream 7 since it is not crippled in any way. It's about the same price but with a TON of enhancements and capabilities the Fire will never do.

review_body: This is an amazing device.  Why three stars instead of five?  When you turn on the Fire HD, special offers are automatically delivered to the device.  Want to turn those off?  Be prepared to pay $15 US for that apparent privilege, Amazon claiming that the advertising subsidizes the cost of the device.  This fact is presented as a purchasing option, which I missed the first time. I find this to be a bit of nickel-and-diming.   Note:  I updated this review, softening my ad criticism, and changed from 3 stars to 4.

review_body:
I really hated to leave my old kindle because it was so user friendly - I don't do change well. My husband got a Fire HD 7 2013 and there were some features I didn't like about it; however, this new kindle fire HD7 has the best of all the features I like. I especially like the power button being located on the top rather than the bottom, my old one had the button on the bottom and I would sometimes turn it off while reading because I would accidentally hit the power button.

The one feature I liked in my old kindle that the new one doesn't have is a light that shows orange while charging and turns green when fully charged. This made it easy to see at a glance when charged.

I upgraded from my first-gen Kindle Fire, and it works similarly. I really dislike that the lock screen is now an ad for some other product, and I don't think you can shut that off. Amazon, I just gave you $150 or so for a new device, please just let me use that device in peace without you trying to sell me more things (unless I tell you that I want to buy them). I've had a few other issues with the photos in the photo gallery not opening properly and closing very suddenly. This has also happened with a few other programs, but it's nothing too serious.

review_body:
This unit was a replacement for a lost Kindle (I put in on top of a car and drove off). I was concerned that if it was found I would have someone using my sign in to buy more books etc. Went to Amazon on line and explained what happened. In a blink of an eye all access to the unit was blocked. The original Kindle was a 6" so I upgraded to the 7". My library was seamlessly transferred to the new Kindle.
I recommend Amazon, and Kindle. Great no hassle customer service. I also recommend keeping track of your Kindle.

I am completely happy with this new Fire. I bought the first generation and didn't like it. I love this one (4th Gen.) I am on a Homeowner Association Board Of Directors and use it for all of my meeting. We have Wi-Fi at the club house and I am able to store my documents on it and can call them up when I need them. I only have to take a thin note book with me to meetings. My wife has a expensive i-pad mini and I can do everything on my Fire that she can.

I have amazon prime so I can stream free movies and free music,

I only paid $89 for it (Regular $139) because of Amazon Prime Day a couple of weeks ago, but I think its a good deal at $139.

review_body: We absolutely love the Kindle.  I use it for everything- reading, email, browsing, calendar, movies, all of it.  Originally, it was purchased for the kids, 3-year-old twins, for educational apps.  But, now, everyone in the family uses it.  The only thing I would change is storage space.  16 GB was filled up within our first week, mainly b/c we downloaded a HD movie for the kids to watch when we are out of Wi-Fi.  I was only able to store one movie, one full length book, a few apps, and a few dozen photos before it was full.  If one becomes available with more storage, we will be upgrading.

review_body: Certainly not an iPad, but a great tablet nonetheless. The only disappointment was my Wife also ordered a case for it and it was too big, even thought it sais right on it that it was for Fire HD 7. I mostly read books on my Kindle and no matter how I pick it up it is ready to read. Battery life a little shorter then I expected, going to try turning off wi fi except when downloading books to see if it improves. Camera is also nice to have so handy, we have become spoiled with camera's, but still real convenient. Also the 16 GB is great, don't Know why it's an option??
VERY PLEASED!!!....

The new Kindle HD7 has no charging light and I do miss that feature.  It is also harder to find the small power button but a case featuring automatic awake and sleep took care of that problem. WOW!!!

When my 1st generation Kindle Fire "bit the dust" I investigated the Fire HD. After my research I decided the the Fire was going to give me the most "bang for my buck'. I am not disappointed in my purchase.

I am still learning other functionality but unless the Fire blows up in my hand I am very happy with it.

I have no "home menu"---if I am in an app, I have to turn off the kindle to get back to the home screen.  Talk about annoying! They replaced it with a brand new fire HD!  I wish this one hadn't died, but am so thrilled that they made it right----even after the warranty because it was an issue with their software, not the kindle itself!

review_body: I had a first generation kindle fire which stopped holding a charge after 3 years or so.  This one is far superior - the keyboard is much more accurate.  I've had it about 2 months now, and am quite fond of it.  And for around $100, it cannot be beat.  We have an iPad 3d generation and the two are not really comparable.  The fire is much better for reading, and because it is affordable, I do things like take it to the gym so I can watch Nexflix while on the eliciptic or into the kitchen for cooking.  So, it's perhpas less a "computer" than the iPad, but it's more a part of my everyday life.

Other than the issues with the interface - great product. I like it.

review_body:
As a long time iPad user I was pleased to find just how well Amazon supported the Kindle fire HD with their own version of the cloud. I used to use my iPad to revive images taken with my cameras, but the generic brand chip reader/USB connector was made incompatible when Apple decided to force you to use their proprietary connector. With the Kindle fire I can connect either a camera, or just it's memory card and down load imagery for revive or manipulation and store them to the cloud... all pretty cool.

Oh, it also makes a great book reader.

review_body: I love the new Fire HD. I have the original fire and this one has so many more options added to it such as the front and rear facing camera which takes great pictures and video. It has a faster processor, a bigger hard drive and lots more apps that are available to download. I am still learning where some of the options and apps are located since they are a little different than my old one. It is lighter in weight and has the volume control on the outside now which I like. It also knows just what I like makes suggestions to me as to how to use it. I am still in the learning phase of this new kindle but, so far I am loving it.

review_body: I love my fire so far. It does most of the things that I need it for well. Watching movies is pleasant, and surfing the web matches most tablets. It isn't horribly fast when opening apps, but for the price I can't gripe. Graphics are marginal, but sound is great. I don't use the camera. I wish there was a home button on the front and hate the charging port being next to the power/feature button on the top. It makes it hard to use when charging and watching movies. Otherwise, its a great tablet. The 7" size is perfect for carrying around, as it can tightly fit in a pocket yet is large enough to surf and type.

The graphics are much better then on my original kindle and the fact that this one has two speakers on the sides make it even better to enjoy what you are watching.  I would recommend this if you are looking for a new kindle.

review_body:
I received this as a Christmas present from my parents and I absolutely love it. I was using an older version that was a few years old and it was starting to malfunction, so when my parents asked what I wanted for Christmas, this was at the top of my list. Great display and easy to navigate through and find what I'm looking for. I will say I wish it had the older version of the Favorites. I don't particularly like all those items on my home screen. I really love that it connects through Goodreads since I use that site all the time.

I would recommend purchasing the 5 ft USB charging cable. Mine came with a 3 ft cable, which definitely isn't long enough.
review_tidy: received Christmas present parents absolutely love using older version years starting malfunction parents asked wanted Christmas list Great display easy navigate find looking wish older version Favorites particularly like items home screen really love connects Goodreads since site time would recommend purchasing charging cable Mine came cable definitely long enough

With my last kindle ( which I loved and lost) There was a light at the bottom that indicated when the battery was charged.  This fire does not have that so I have to open up the case all the time to see if the battery is charged. With some games the tap on the screen does not respond. Overall, I do like the product.
